HomePage.title: AI Cybersecurity Self-Assessment
HomePage.description: Platform for self-assessment of compliance with ZKS/NIS2 regulations using advanced AI technology for analysis and improvement recommendations.

zks_nis2.question: What is ZKS/NIS2 directive and why is it important?
zks_nis2.answer: ZKS (Cybersecurity Act) is the Croatian law that implements the EU NIS2 directive. It prescribes cybersecurity obligations for essential and important entities in Croatia, including banks, energy companies, telecommunications and other critical sectors.

create_assessment.question: How to start a new self-assessment?
create_assessment.answer: Go to "Assessments" in the main menu and click "New Assessment". Choose the appropriate security level (basic, medium, advanced) depending on the size and complexity of your organization.

security_levels.question: What is the difference between security levels?
security_levels.answer: Basic level (227 controls) is for smaller organizations, medium and advanced level (277 controls) for larger and more complex organizations with higher risks.

scoring.question: How are controls evaluated?
scoring.answer: Each control is evaluated on a scale of 1-5 for documentation and implementation. 1 = non-existent, 2 = partial, 3 = satisfactory, 4 = good, 5 = excellent.

duration.question: How long does it take to complete a self-assessment?
duration.answer: Depending on the size of the organization and security level, a self-assessment can take from 2-4 weeks for basic level to 6-8 weeks for advanced level.

export.question: Can I export self-assessment results?
export.answer: Yes, you can export results in PDF format for reporting or Excel format for further analysis. Export is available in the "Reports" section.

account_settings.question: How can I change account settings?
account_settings.answer: Go to "Settings" where you can edit profile, notification settings, security settings and manage data in accordance with GDPR regulations.

gdpr_compliance.question: Is the platform compliant with GDPR regulations?
gdpr_compliance.answer: Yes, the platform is fully compliant with GDPR regulations. All data is stored in the Republic of Croatia and you can request data export or deletion at any time.

spiderDiagram.description: Analyze multi-dimensional compliance data using radar charts.

heatMap.description: Identify risk and compliance areas using heat map visualizations.

heatMap.interpretationMatrix: The compliance matrix shows submeasure compliance percentages across all measures
heatMap.interpretationGaps: The gaps analysis highlights controls with the largest differences between documentation and implementation
heatMap.interpretationColors: Colors range from red (low compliance) through amber and blue to green (high compliance)
